att2.healthbar.display.select.view_range: §e§lPortée de Visibilité de la Barre de Vie

Les barres de vie ennemies ne s'afficheront que dans une certaine portée
Portée de Visibilité =
<Portée de Vue> x <Paramètres Vidéo: Distance de Rendu des Entités> x 64 blocs

att2.move_light.display.select.hover_eve: Players with shaders/dynamic light mods installed may choose to disable this to avoid potential issues
att2.item_color.display.select.show_text: Click to expand §6§lItem Color Display Settings
att2.item_color.display.select.hover_eve: Since the item particle effect feature checks for dropped items every tick (even reducing particle quality in game settings won't help), when there are too many dropped items, it may cause TPS instability (press F3+2 to view TPS fluctuations in the bottom right corner). This feature allows only specific quality items to show particle effects. Disabling all particle effects can significantly optimize TPS

att2.misc.maze_torch.name: §c§lNetherfire Glow
att2.misc.maze_torch.lore.1: §c§lThe only faint light in endless darkness
att2.chest.secret.name: §6§lLegendary Chest
att2.assist.conscience.1: The <Book of Awakening> provides extensive game information throughout your journey
att2.assist.conscience.2: The first page displays your current level, Dahal limit, and title
att2.assist.conscience.3: On the first page, click <Protagonist> to change your name, click <Book Instructions> to view usage guides for both the book and Dahal spells
att2.assist.conscience.4: In the <Skill Points> section, spend points to enhance base attributes
att2.assist.conscience.5: The <Game Assistance> section provides hints for current <Main Quests> or <Side Quests>
att2.assist.conscience.6: In <Game Assistance>, <Visual Settings> lets you adjust: <Monster Health Bars>, <Attribute Display>, <Item Particle Effects>, <Torch Dynamic Lighting>, <Title Particles>, and <View Shaking>
att2.assist.conscience.7: The <Game Assistance> section allows reviewing <Dialogue Options> and <Tips List> to recall game knowledge
att2.assist.conscience.8: In <Game Assistance>, click <Horse Whistle> to quickly summon/dismiss mounts (unavailable during special scenes or quests)
att2.assist.conscience.9: The <Return to Checkpoint> function costs 100 Chronotons (unavailable during special scenes or quests)
att2.assist.conscience.10: <Item Gathering> collects nearby <drops> and <experience orbs>, with range increasing as main quest progresses
att2.assist.conscience.11: The <Dimensional Pocket> section lets you summon/transfer this storage space
att2.assist.conscience.12: After buying repair tools from blacksmiths, use <Quick Repair> anywhere
att2.assist.conscience.13: The <Language> section allows real-time game language adjustment
att2.assist.conscience.14: The <Currency> section shows Chronotons (or press Tab) and bank balance, with sharing functionality
att2.assist.conscience.15: The <Inscription Bonuses> section displays crafting recipes and current engravings
att2.assist.conscience.16: The <Waypoint Guide> provides navigation to teleportation circles
att2.assist.conscience.18: The <Tutorial> section explains special item mechanics
att2.assist.conscience.19: <Travel Log> tracks <Shining Points> collection progress per region
att2.assist.conscience.21: The <Difficulty Selection> changes game difficulty <Non-Nightmare only>
att2.assist.shop.1: <Chronotons> are the primary currency for purchasing items from merchants
att2.assist.shop.2: <Chaos Scales> are rare currency for black market <exotics>, <Recall Spell>, and <Small Pouches> in Ryliath/Eolorion
att2.assist.shop.3: Sell unwanted items to <Recycling Merchants> - higher quality = better prices/EXP
att2.assist.shop.4: [Blacksmiths] and [Potion Vendors] randomly stock most items (higher rarity = lower chance). Refresh manually or wait 30 minutes
att2.assist.shop.5: Charles' Casino in Soquai Forest offers betting for random rewards (main quest unlocks higher tiers)
att2.assist.shop.6: Fishermen sell <fishing gear> for Sylberland's waters
att2.assist.shop.7: Estelle_NPC at Ryliath's gate sells <small chairs>, <Sylberland maps>, <torches>
att2.assist.shop.9: Using [blacksmiths] improves [Smithing Level], enhancing repairs and inventory
att2.assist.shop.11: Right-click <Timer Plaques> under shop stalls (250 Chronotons to refresh)
att2.assist.shop.12: Charles Casino's <7777 Bet> may reward <Angband>, <Billgart>, <Ouranos> dimensional items
att2.assist.travel.2: <Sylberland Map> records landmarks (unlocked via main/side quests). Click waypoints with mounts for auto-travel
att2.assist.difficult.1: [Death] returns you to last checkpoint with <Chronoton>, <EXP>, and <satiety> penalties (worse at higher difficulties)
att2.assist.difficult.2: Four difficulties: [Beginner][Veteran][Master][Nightmare]. Higher difficulties boost enemy stats but improve rewards
att2.assist.difficult.3: [Nightmare] loses 50% Chronotons, all satiety, and massive EXP on death. Enemies spawn faster with greatly enhanced stats
att2.assist.difficult.4: Enemy tiers: <Normal>, <Elite>, <Super Elite>, <Ultimate Elite>. Higher tiers have size/speed/damage/resistance bonuses and extra rewards
att2.assist.difficult.5: Health bar colors indicate level: Green→Dark Green→Yellow→Dark Yellow→Red→Dark Red (Normal) / Blue→Dark Blue→Dark Cyan (Elite)
att2.assist.item.2: Five weapon types with different speeds/damage: [Dagger][Sword][Axe][Spear][Hammer]
att2.assist.item.4: Angband's gold equipment self-repairs over time
att2.assist.item.5: Chainmail adds +2 max HP per piece
att2.assist.item.6: Alloy armor adds +1 HP and knockback resistance
att2.assist.item.7: Leather armor (common across dimensions) provides superior knockback resistance
att2.assist.item.8: Potions grant temporary attribute boosts (non-stacking durations)
att2.assist.item.9: Spears temporarily reduce <Attack Speed> after each strike
att2.assist.item.10: 13 Epic/Legendary sets with <Set Bonuses> for full equips
att2.assist.item.11: After breaking Asunark's arena gate, buy <Octarian Armor> from HomerNPC for underwater mobility
att2.assist.item.12: [Pelzions] (Wings of Freedom) is the only indestructible non-mythic gear
att2.assist.item.13: <Ultimate> gear appears mostly in mid-late game
att2.assist.enchantment.1: Ryliath's Enchantment Room (near Dahal Master) uses <Chaos Scales> and <Rune Powder>
att2.assist.enchantment.5: Longbow's <Anchored Shot> boosts damage but roots you
att2.assist.enchantment.8: Shield's <Perfect Block> shortens stance duration but enables counterattacks
att2.assist.enchantment.9: Shield's <Defensive Field> blocks omnidirectional attacks (immobile while raised)
att2.assist.enchantment.10: Sword's <Sword-Shield Synergy> boosts STR/ATK SPD when alternating, culminating in AoE bursts
att2.assist.enchantment.11: Sword's <One-Handed> blocks attacks (successful blocks empower next strike)
att2.assist.enchantment.13: Dagger's <Finisher> stacks bonus damage on consecutive hits
att2.assist.enchantment.14: Dagger's <Backstab> teleports behind enemies (requires open space) with brief ATK/MOV SPD boost
att2.assist.enchantment.15: Axe's <Armor Breaker> reduces target defense on first hit
att2.assist.enchantment.16: Axe's <Thousand Cuts> gains ATK per kill but reduces max HP%
att2.assist.enchantment.17: Spear's <Unstoppable Thrust> enhances sprint attacks with knockback
att2.assist.enchantment.19: Helmet's <Perspective Shift> modifies STR/MOV SPD based on undead activity cycles (day/night)
att2.assist.enchantment.20: Helmet's <Mana Siphon> increases Dahal capacity but reduces HP
att2.assist.enchantment.22: Helmet's <Gourmet> boosts HP Regen after eating three foods
att2.assist.enchantment.23: Chestplate's <Heartguard> knocks back enemies and fully heals you at low HP (once only)
att2.assist.enchantment.24: Chestplate's <Mana Surge> empowers next offensive spell
att2.assist.enchantment.25: Chestplate's <Selfless> boosts HP Regen but may drain durability
att2.assist.enchantment.27: Leggings' <Treasure Hunter> grants <Gold Rush> (luck boost) after opening chests
att2.assist.enchantment.28: Leggings' <Spell Overload> increases Dahal Regen when wielding spellcasters
att2.assist.enchantment.29: Boots' <Fluid Motion> lets you step onto 1-block heights
att2.assist.enchantment.30: Boots' <Blazing Dash> boosts sprint speed but drains satiety
att2.assist.enchantment.33: Boots' <Rapid Cooldown> improves spell haste but may drain HP
att2.assist.boss.1: Most [BOSSES] respawn. Fast kills grant [ESC/Rune rewards] and [Speedrun Achievements]
att2.assist.boss.3: You can peacefully negotiate with [Ouranos King]
att2.assist.legendary.5: [Fenrir] (Sword): Freezes targets + ice field (user immune to cold)
att2.assist.legendary.6: [Fortuity] (Sword): Generates EXP orbs + luck stacks (scales with level)
att2.assist.legendary.10: [Lone_Shadow] (Dagger): Stealth mode stores damage for explosions
att2.assist.legendary.11: [Kinuil] (Axe): Flame field + marked target chains (heat immunity)
att2.assist.dahal.1: 30 spells: [Destruction][Summoning][Alteration]. Most purchasable, some require quests
att2.assist.dahal.3: Select tier in spellbook to ready caster (right-click to cast)
att2.assist.dahal.4: Spell EXP scales with [player level][spell tier][inscriptions]
att2.assist.dahal.5: Spellbooks show details. Throwing refreshes data. Click [spell names] for tier info
att2.assist.dahal.7: <Dimensional Pocket> upgrades with space gems (quick navigation commands)
att2.assist.dahal.14: <Thermal Spring>: Knocks up enemies + fire resistance
att2.assist.dahal.37: <Corrupting Power>, <Supernova>, and destructive spells cannot be stacked
att2.assist.leveling.1: EXP sources: kills, achievements, crafting, quests
att2.assist.leveling.2: Three level types: [Normal][Master][Immortal]. Level-ups fully heal HP/Dahal
att2.assist.leveling.6: Player level scales enemy stats (caps at 50)
att2.assist.attribute.1: Eight attributes: <STR><RES><ATK SPD><MOV SPD><LUCK><SATIETY><HP REGEN><DAHAL REGEN>
att2.assist.attribute.10: Modified by gear, spells, potions, enchantments
att2.assist.attribute.11: +5 skill points per space gem placed
att2.assist.attribute.12: Respec at Ryliath's <Skill Master> (cost scales with level)
att2.assist.reputation.5: Higher reputation improves shop discounts/rarity rates
att2.assist.quest.1: New quests unlock via [main story] and [reputation]
att2.assist.quest.2: Some quests require items (deliver on gold pressure plates)
att2.assist.quest.3: [Ultimate Challenge] unlocks after 59 side quests (parkour/arena rewards)
att2.assist.exploit.2: Use map waypoints with mounts for auto-travel
att2.assist.exploit.5: Every 150 points unlocks rewards at Ryliath's <Writh_Razgork> warehouse
att2.assist.exploit.7: 90+ hidden shulker boxes (disguised as blocks) with premium loot
att2.assist.exploit.8: Cracked walls require <Seismic Resonance> from Billgart
att2.assist.exploit.9: Frozen treasures need <Flame Resonance> from Vonaheim
att2.assist.exploit.11: Kortaek's temple maze contains <Netherfire Glow> for navigation
att2.assist.exploit.13: Some hidden achievements grant no points
att2.assist.bow.2: [Glow Arrows] deal bonus damage (found in Angband/Ourans)
att2.assist.house.2: Pay Chronotons to expand (more storage, inter-estate teleportation)
att2.assist.temperature.2: [Heat] in Kert/Nojelanth deserts reduces [ATK SPD][MOV SPD][DAHAL REGEN]
att2.assist.temperature.4: Modified by [day/night cycles] and [armor type/amount] (leather increases warmth)
att2.assist.random_event.1: <Lost Souls> in Telluron grant EXP/Chronotons (scaling with level)
att2.assist.random_event.2: <Monster Hordes> spawn with thunder/particles (contain runic chests/mimics)
att2.assist.random_event.3: <Mimics> appear when opening chests (sound cues). Passive until attacked
att2.assist.runes.1: 27 types from kills/chests/crafting (rarer = lower drop rates)
att2.assist.runes.3: Activated inscriptions grant: [Monster EXP][Currency Bonus][Spell EXP][Cooldown Reduction][Dahal Cap][HP Cap][Potion Duration][Boss Rewards]
att2.assist.runes.4: Left-click switches between crafting/grinding. Right-click shows recipes
att2.assist.runes.5: Grind runes into powder for spell boosts/enchantments
att2.assist.runes.6: Advanced runes require unlocking prerequisite runes
att2.assist.runes.7: 20 inscription types (max 10 active). No duplicates. Level restrictions apply
att2.assist.runes.8: Rumors of a hidden dungeon requiring runic knowledge
att2.assist.gameplay.2: [Mounts] enable fast travel (price = speed/HP). Pair with <Sylberland Map>
att2.assist.gameplay.4: [Small Pouches] from black markets hold runes/spellcasters
att2.assist.gameplay.5: Different potion effects stack (same types override)
att2.assist.gameplay.9: Non-melee weapons deal reduced melee damage
att2.assist.gameplay.10: Survival time boosts EXP gains (up to 2x, resets on death)
att2.shop.mending.quick_mending.title: §e[§e§lRepair Equipment§e]§8==§e[§e§lRepair Tools§e]
att2.shop.mending.quick_mending.head: >Helmet<
att2.shop.mending.quick_mending.head.sho: Click to repair currently equipped helmet
att2.shop.mending.quick_mending.chest.sh: Click to repair currently equipped chestplate
att2.shop.mending.quick_mending.legs.sho: Click to repair currently equipped leggings
att2.shop.mending.quick_mending.feet.sho: Click to repair currently equipped boots
att2.shop.mending.quick_mending.all.show: Click to repair all currently equipped armor
